turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Too bad you didn't connect.  You could have gone to Juvenile Hall. That's what you want, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sure it is.  You want to bug us till we have to lock you up.  Why?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't know why--!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Go on--don't give me that.  Someone giving you hard looks?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I just get so--  Boy, sometimes the temperature goes way up. RAY  Okay.  Okay.  Let it out.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You feel like you want to blow your wheels right now?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: All the time!  I don't know what gets into me--but I keep looking for trouble and I always--I swear you better lock me up.  I'm going to smash somebody--I know it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Try the desk.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That why you moved from the last town? 'Cause you were in trouble? You can talk about it if you want to--I know about it anyway. Routine check.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And they think they are protecting my by moving.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You were getting a good start in the wrong direction back there. Why did you do it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Mess that kid up?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He called me chicken.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: And your folks didn't understand?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: They never do.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: So then you moved?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: They think I'll make friends if we move.  Just move and everything'll be roses and sunshine.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: But you don't think that's a solution.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Things pretty tough for you at home?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: She eats him alive and he takes it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What a zoo!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: A zoo.  He always wants to be my pal, you know?  But how can I give him anything when he's--I mean I love him and I don't want to hurt him--but I don't know what to do anymore except maybe die.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Pretty mixed up?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: If he could--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: "If he could" what?  You mean your father?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I mean if he had the guts to knock Mom cold once I bet she'd be happy and I bet she'd stop picking.  They make mush out of him.  Just mush. One thing I know is I never want to be like him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Chicken?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I bet you see right through me, don't you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How can anyone grow up in this circus?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You got me, Jim--but they do.  Want some water?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Boy--if I had one day when I didn't have to be all confused and ashamed of everything--or I felt I belonged some place.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Here.  Look, will you do something for me?  If the pot starts boiling again, will you come and see me before you get yourself in a jam? Even if you just want to talk--come in and shoot the breeze.  It's easier sometimes than talking to your folks.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Okay--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Any time--day or night.  You calmed down enough to go back now?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You serious?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Hey!  That's enough static out of you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Want me to imitate a stupid cop?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Cut it out now.  I'm warning you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Assault with a deadly weapon.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Listen--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Plato!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Just walk over here quietly now-- and there won't be any trouble.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hi.  I saw you before.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Bully for you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You don't have to be unfriendly.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Now that's true!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: See?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: "Life is crushing in on me."

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: "Life can be beautiful." Hey, I know where it was.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Where what was.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where I saw you.  Everything going okay now?  You live around here?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Who lives?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: See, I'm new.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Won't mother be proud.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're really flipped--aren't you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where's Dawson High School?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You going there?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah--why--

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Dig the square wardrobe!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah.  So where's the high school?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: University and 10th--Want to carry my books?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: The kids take me.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I'll bet you're a real yo yo.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Goodbye!  See you!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm not so bad.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: They'll be looking for you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: They saw where I jumped!  I didn't chicken!  What do I have to do-- kill myself?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: It doesn't matter to them.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You were looking for me, weren't you?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: No--I was just--maybe--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I tried to call you before. JUDY I thought so.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You still pretty upset?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I'm numb.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You cold?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Even if I'm near a fire, I'm cold. I guess just about everybody's cold.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I swear, sometimes, you just want to hold onto somebody!  Judy, what am I going to do?  I can't go home again.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Neither can I.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No?  Why not?  You know something?  Sometimes I figure I'll never live to see my next birthday.  Isn't that dumb?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Every day I look in the mirror and say, "What?  You still here?" Man!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Like even today.  I woke up this morning, you know?  And the sun was shining and everything was nice. Then the first thing that happens is I see you and I thought this is going to be one terrific day so you better live it up, boy, 'cause tomorrow maybe you'll be nothing.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I'm sorry I treated you mean today. You shouldn't believe what I say when I'm with the kids.  Nobody acts sincere.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why'd you get mixed up with them? You don't have to prove anything.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: If you knew me you wouldn't say that.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't think you trust anybody, do you?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm getting that way, too.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Have you ever gone with anyone who--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure.  Lots of times.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: So have I.  But I've never been in love.  Isn't that awful?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Awful?  No.  It's just lonely. It's the loneliest time.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Why did you do that?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I felt like it.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Your lips are soft when you kiss.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't know, but we can't stay here.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where can we go?  I can't go back into that zoo.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I'm never going back.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Listen!  I know a place!  PLATO showed me before.  An old deserted mansion near the planetarium  Would you go with me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You can trust me, Judy.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I feel as if I'm walking under water.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Oh, Jim!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No--come on.  Should we rent or are we in a buying mood, dear?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You decide, darling.  Remember our budget.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why don't we just rent it for the season?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You see, we've just--oh, you tell him, darling.  I'm so embarrassed I could die!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well--we're newlyweds.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: There's just one thing.  What about--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Of course.  Drown them like puppies.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: See, we're very modern.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You can't talk underwater!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I bet you hear everything I say!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ever been in a place like this before?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Not exactly.  It's certainly huge.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How many rooms do you think there are?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Should we explore?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Want to read any books?  Take your pick!  Isn't this the craziest?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Your hand's all wet and it's shaky.  You're so funny.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't know--you just are. Leaving a light for Plato.  That was nice.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Maybe he's scared of the dark.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Are you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Here we are-- out of cigarettes-- Junior's in the nurs'ry-- See how late it gets--

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You don't need to do that.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There's something I should tell you, Judy.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I know already.  We don't have to pretend now.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What a relief!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Is this what it's like to love somebody?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You disappointed?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Funny Jimmy.  You're so clean and you--this is silly.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You smell like baby powder.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So do you.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I never felt so clean before.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's not going to be lonely, Judy. Not for you and not for me.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I love somebody.  All the time I've been looking for someone to love me and now--I love somebody.  And it's so easy.  Why is it easy now?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It is for me too.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I love you, Jim.  I really mean it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: We have to go back!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No!  I got to find him.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: After he tried to shoot you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He didn't mean it--we shouldn't have left him.  He needed us.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: He needed you, maybe.  So do I.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You should have heard him talk about you tonight.  Like you were the hero in the China Seas.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure.  He was trying to make us his family.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: They're killing him!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Is he your friend?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Yes.  My best friend.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: What's he like?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Oh, I don't know.  You have to get to know him.  He doesn't say much but when he does you know he means it.  He's sincere.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Well, that's the main thing--don't you think so?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Maybe next summer he's going to take me hunting with him--and fishing.  I want him to teach me how and I bet he won't get mad if I goof.  His name's Jim.  It's really James but he likes Jim more.  People he really likes--he lets call him "Jamie."

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Want to finish my hamburger?  I only took a bite.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Don't give it a thought.  Only three million dollars a month!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Oh, we can manage that!  I'll scrimp and save and work my fingers to the bone...

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Children?  Well, we really don't encourage them.  They're so noisy and troublesome, don't you agree?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Yes.  And so terribly annoying when they cry.  I just don't know what to do when they cry, do you dear?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Shall I show you the nursery?  It's far away from the rest of the house. If you have children--Oh I hate the word!--or if you decide to adopt one--they can carry on and you'll never even notice.  In fact, if you lock them in you never have to see them again, much less talk to them.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Talk to them!  Heavens!

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Plato, where's your father now?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: He's dead.  He was a hero in the China Sea. JIM You told me he's a big wheel in New York!

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: I did?  Well, he might as well be dead.  What's the difference?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Hi, Plato!

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Judy--we're ready for you now.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: He hates me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: He hates me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What makes you think he hates you, Judy?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I don't think.  I know.  He looks at me like I'm the ugliest thing in the world.  He doesn't like my friends--he--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He makes you feel pretty unhappy?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: He calls me a dirty tramp--my own father!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Do you think your father means that?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Yes!  I don't know!  I mean maybe he doesn't mean it but he acts like he does.  We're altogether and we're going to celebrate Easter and catch a double bill.  Big deal.  So I put on my new dress and I came out and he--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That one?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Yes--he started yelling for a handkerchief--screaming.  He grabbed my face and he rubbed all my lipstick off--he rubbed till I thought I wouldn't have any lips left.  And all the time yelling at me--that thing--the thing I told you he called me.  Then I ran out of the house.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Is that why you were wandering around at one o'clock in the morning?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I was just talking a walk.  I tried to call the kids but everybody was out and I couldn't find them.  I hate my life.  I just hate it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You weren't looking for company, were you?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Did you stop to talk to anyone, Judy?  Do you enjoy that?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: No.  I don't even know why I do it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Do you think you can get back at your Dad that way?  I mean sometimes if we can't get as close to somebody as we'd like we have to try making them jealous--so they'll have to pay attention.  Did you ever think of that?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I'll never get close to anybody.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Some kids stomped a man on Twelfth Street, Judy.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You know where they picked me up! Twelfth Street!  I wasn't even near there!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Would you like to go home if we can arrange it?  Did you notify the parents?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Your mother will be down in a few minutes, Judy--

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Your mother will be down in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: My mother?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She's being called for.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: You said you'd call my father.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Goodbye, Judy.  Take it easy.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: How did you know that?

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: We used to sing it in school.  Don't look at me with such horror. They had schools in those days.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: But the same song.  I think it's fantastic!

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: We were romantic then too--

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Are you and Mom home tonight?

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: No.  Why?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Nothing, only it'd be nice to spend an evening together for a change.

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: With us old creeps?  Come on, we have to eat.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Daddy--

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Good evening.

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Didn't you forget something?

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: You're too old for that kind of stuff, kiddo.  I thought you stopped doing that long ago.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I didn't want to stop.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I was talking to Dad.

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: I didn't kiss her so it's a big thing.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: I guess I just don't understand anything.

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: I'm tired, Judy.  I'd like to change the subject.

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JUDY'S FATHER
turns.text: I'd like to, that's all.  Girls your age don't do that.  You need an explanation?

turns.speaker: JUDY
turns.text: Girls don't love their father? Since when?  Since I got to be sixteen?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: So. This is the guy you been waiting for. Man of your dreams.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel -- !

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Must have a way with stationery.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel, what are you doing!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You better be here to be good to her, loverboy. 'Cause she's been good to you.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel, let him go --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Read a lot about you, Nick.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What are you doing here?!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Read you're a man of some knowledge.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: A man of some travels.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: GABRIEL, I LOVE HIM!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Is this him!?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Don't hurt him...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Is this the fucker you been writing all year!?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Please, Gabriel, don't...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: IS THIS NICK MASON!!??

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: YES!!!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel, you promised!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I promised that when he helped us, we'd be gone! When he helped us! Loverboy don't want to play!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You promised me!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: And you promised me you'd get your sweetheart to help!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He'd rather die than be with you, he'd make a fucked-up boyfriend anyway.  Bury him all over the place.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel! You said talk to him. That's all you ever said...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: We're talking, aren't we?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He wants the money.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No, baby. He wants me.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He wants... your "sister"...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: ...whoever she is.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: All those letters are about to pay off, baby... all those letters...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: To all those cons...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Searching for a money man...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: We musta written what, twenty of 'em? And they were before this guy. One, two letters apiece, ten to the racetrack guy in Leavenworth --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: -- till he fucked his parole --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: -- plus the forty to Mason... how many letters is that?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: That's a book, baby.  That's a book of love.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I can't take watching you touch him. I can't take his hands on you.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: One more day, baby. One more day to Christmas.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I've been doing good, though.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Didn't have to hit me so fucking hard. Didn't have to throw me outta the goddamn truck.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Didn't have to send me down a fucking mountain.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What, he should see me help you catch him?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He's shown us the setup, he's drawn us the map, he's helped us do the plan. He wants a gun, give him a gun. Take the bullets out, whatever, but give him the gun. The more manpower we've got in there, the better. He won't try and make his move till the money's in hand.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He'll be dead when he does.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Y'know something, baby? If you were my sister? I'd still want to wake up Christmas morning with you...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Mmm, baby. And I'd still want to be the tinsel round your tree...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: That's for the hundred bucks worth of pay-per-view.  And that's for the two hundred you took outta your minibar.

turns.speaker: TEEN CLERK
turns.text: You can't find... what?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Toys for adults. Where are your toys for adults?

turns.speaker: TEEN CLERK
turns.text: Toys for... adults?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: C'mon. How old are you, sixteen? C'mon.

turns.speaker: TEEN CLERK
turns.text: We sell children's toys --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I got fifty dollars to spend in your store, Jesus of Nazareth. Can you help me or not?

turns.speaker: TEEN CLERK
turns.text: Slinky's in aisle five, Twister's in aisle one, Moon Mud's in aisle four.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Gotta be ten degrees out there.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Radio said negative five.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Negative five?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I don't think it's negative five.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Radio said.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I figured you walked outta there and saw me and walked right the other way --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, no --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Saw my outfit or something, my coat --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, hey, I like your coat --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Saw me --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ashley, no. That was me, that's what I was scared of. I mean, be serious... I ain't exactly looking like Mr. Universe here.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You are to me.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Thought you wrote you had a mustache.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I can get another one going. Y'know, hey, whatever you want me to --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No, no, no. Be like you want to be.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Do that again.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Smile.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: One more. Smile. One more.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No, c'mon --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I've been dreaming about that smile, Ashley Mercer. For a long time.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Tell me something. This the first time you've ever done this?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Go to hell, Nick Mason, what's that supposed to mean --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, not that, no...  I mean this, the whole thing. Start writing to a guy, guy in the bricks. Get a boyfriend like this. Tell me the truth.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Well. You're not the first guy I wrote to. But you're the only one I kept writing to.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah. Me too.  Why? I mean I know why for me, why I paid for the ad. But you... why start writing to some guy -- some con -- you don't even know?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I told you, Nick. Remember?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Tell me again.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: All the guys I've ever been with... they never want to know me. Who I am on the inside. They just want to qet inside. When they do, they think that means they know who I am. That I trust them. That they know me. That there's nothing left to learn.  A guy like you, Nick -- six months before you can even touch my face. I figure a guy in that kind of bind, he's gonna hafta work to get to know me some other way.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Had some bad relationships, didn't you.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Not bad. Just regular.  You wrote me wonderful things, Nick. Personal things.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Well, wasn't all me, y'know.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Yes it was all you --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Guy I was in with... he helped sometimes... some of the romantic stuff, actually... you'd like him --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I'm talking about the heart, Nick. I'm not talking about the words.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Y'know, some of the heart mighta been his too...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Then he shoulda signed his name.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Where the hell are you going?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Provisions! We are not leaving that motel room again till after New Year's: we need ten days worth of provisions!  What's good?!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ashley, Jesus --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Can't survive on our bodies alone, Nick.  Hurry up!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ash... didn't you write me that you don't eat chocolate?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Yeah, well you wrote me you were six- foot-four, baby.  So don't talk to me about little white lies.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You need a COAT!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ash, you've gotten me enough --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No boyfriend of mine is going to walk around in negative-five degree wind chill without a goddamn good- looking coat!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Baby, c'mon, all this stuff... I haven't gotten you anything --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You got out, Nick. You're here. You're my Christmas.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You forget where I work?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Beauty and fragrances.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Fifty percent off, motherfucker. Ho ho ho.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Well, I don't know about that --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Blackjack, Nick, blackjack I am good at. I mean, they'd give us some free games or something, wouldn't they? Since you worked there?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Security, Ash, I just worked security. They wouldn't be rolling out the red carpet --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: And the slots, slots I'm good at too. Wouldn't that be fun?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We'll have more fun in Detroit.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: We could live it up and --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ashley. We're not going anywhere I used to work.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Baby, I'm gonna go tell 'em not to disturb us for the rest of the year. I get back in that room, you better be wearing nothing but a candy cane.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No, lover. I'll see what you can do.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: NICK!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm not him. I...  You want something from Nick, you got the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I won't let 'em, Nick. They won't hurt you anymore.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Your brother...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...the truck driver...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He's not a bad person, Nick... he's not...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Since Janey moved in... Gabriel... he's come over more and more. To the apartment. Janey's the divorced one, 'member, with the tit job --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What the fuck is going on.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He read the letters, Nick. Some day I wasn't there. He went through my room. He found your letters.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What's going ON!!!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You motherfucker.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, no --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You sold him out.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: When'd you decide to do it, Ash? After which of his letters, huh? The fortieth? The fiftieth? The first?!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, what are you --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'M NOT NICK!  You thought you'd fuck him over?! Well he's fucked you! I've never worked at some casino! I can't help you! Because he's not me!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, I love you --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: JESUS CHRIST!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get the hell off of me!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, it won't work. It won't work!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He'll kill you.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're not hearing me here --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: My brother's killed people, I know he has. Truckers. If you talk him into thinking you're not you, you'll only get yourself dead.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: He didn't "find" Nick's letters, did he.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, please, it's me --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You told him about Nick's letters.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No, Nick, no --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're in on this.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I love you!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Your pen palls dead, lady.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: If you say that, if you keep saying that, they will kill you. If they think you're not you, they will kill you. Don't you see? I know what you're doing, but it won't work!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Nick died for me....

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I won't let him hurt you! He just wants what you know!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...maybe I die for Nick...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Just tell him what you know, Nick! That's all they want! And we'll get out of this!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Gabriel!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Canada.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: They changed the layout -- whadda they call you? Mr. Monster? They remodeled the place. When I worked there -- listen to me -- guy that managed the joint, guy who ran it--

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Jack. Jack Bangs.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Right, Jack Bangs. Uh... guy was always talking bout fixing the place up. Maybe get a better crowd. Musta gone and done it while I was in the Mountain.  I don't know this map, man. How the hell am I supposed to tell you what door goes where?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He said he wanted to talk to you. When he found the letters... he said "when your boyfriend gets out, I wanna talk to him." I thought he meant back in Detroit. I thought he meant --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: But you knew why. Knew why, didn't ya.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I thought we'd have a few more days.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: For what? You to talk me into "helping"? What, he promise you a share of the winnings?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Well, shit, Judas, you shoulda at least gotten that --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick! He wants to know how to rob it, and he'll leave you alone! That's all he wants!  I hate him, Nick... you know how...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: So get him outta your life. Get out of Michigan. They got perfume counters in Chicago, don't they?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Not without you.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Since when do some trucker pals start thinking big, anyway?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: They run routes mostly east, retail stuff, warehouses. But Gabriel knows some guys in New York, Miami, guys he helps get guns to Detroit. Hides 'em with his regular loads.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: He working for them on this one?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No. He wants to be working for himself someday.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: And I'm his ticket.  What's the last place they took down?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Gabriel and his guys. What's the last place they robbed?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: They've never done a robbery?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: They're truck drivers.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Then they do need me, don't they. They really need me...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: We're gonna get out of here, Nick. We're gonna get out of this...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We? What "we"...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get your own room, Ashley.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get your own room.
